title: Let's summarize police brutal acts to foreigners

replies.msg:
1. Arrest pregnant woman (Tuen Mun, Oct 7)
2. Hit reporter (Ma On Shan, Oct 7)
3. Intrude private premises and push securities (Ma On Shan, Oct 7)
4. Arrests many children at the age of around 12-13 (everywhere, everyday)
5. Suddenly charge and arrest Kai Fongs (Wong Tai Sin, Oct 7)
6. Did not charge a taxi driver who hit and broke the leg of a female protestor (Sham Shui Po, Oct 6)
7. Several time shot at eyes of protesters (most notably Tsim Sha Tsui, Aug 11 - also Admiralty, Jun 12; Kowloon Bay, Aug 24)
8. Shot lethal bullet at a 18-year old student (Tsuen Wan, Oct 1)
9. And shoot many other lethal bullets too (multiple occassions)
10. Raped female and broke the limbs, even rumoured to have killed male at San Uk Ling Detention Centre (before Carrie Lam claimed it was closed. But it should have extended to Police Stations all over HK)
11. Hit, and rumoured to have killed, non-protesters in a subway station (Prince Edward Station, Aug 31)
12. Used 39 minute to approach crime scene and did not arrest any terrorists (Yuen Long, Jul 21)
13. Overuse of tear gas and almost most of the canisters found were expired (everywhere, everyday)
14. Shortened the time of permitted demonstrations and assemblies with only a 30-minute notification for evacuation (e.g. Assembly pledging the bill to pass and march to US Embassy, 8 Sep)
15. Disagreement to peaceful protests (so many times)
16. Disguises as protesters (so many times too)

Welcome to do "Solitaire"

Just now written in a Japanese thread so let me recap in English.

Do you know Lion-bird, the almighty sacred animal?

Now, Hong Kong's justice can no longer rely on the Black Police who have lost the sense of righteousness. In cases where judgement is sought, Lion-bird will always come to true Hong Kongers. Lion-bird will punish evils who had done any unacceptable behaviour. For example, a taxi driver ran into the crowd and heavily injured a young lady last Saturday and Lion-bird appeared to the crowd and did what justice meant to.
